nodes.bodyText: Can you please change this as well? 7 -> 8
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@
 Open Telemetry Auto Instrumentation's minimal supported version is java 7.
 All jar files that we produce, unless noted otherwise, have bytecode
 compatible with java 7 runtime. In addition to that we test our code with all

@@ -29,5 +29,5 @@ jobs:
         run: |
           ./gradlew jib -PtargetJDK=8 -Djib.httpTimeout=120000 -Djib.console=plain
           ./gradlew jib -PtargetJDK=11 -Djib.httpTimeout=120000 -Djib.console=plain
-          ./gradlew jib -PtargetJDK=14 -Djib.httpTimeout=120000 -Djib.console=plain
+          ./gradlew jib -PtargetJDK=15 -Djib.httpTimeout=120000 -Djib.console=plain

nodes.bodyText:
We do test with java 8 :) Our official policy is like this:

Test with java 8
Test with all current LTS versions
Test with the latest released version if it is not LTS

Can you add this information here? If you think this is too accidental for this PR, we can do that separately, no worries.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,10 +2,10 @@
 
 #### Java versions
 
-Open Telemetry Auto Instrumentation's minimal supported version is java 7.
+Open Telemetry Auto Instrumentation's minimal supported version is java 8.
 All jar files that we produce, unless noted otherwise, have bytecode
-compatible with java 7 runtime. In addition to that we test our code with all
-later java versions as well: from 8 to 15.
+compatible with java 8 runtime. In addition to that we test our code with all
+later java versions as well: 11 and 15.

@@ -2,10 +2,10 @@
 
 #### Java versions
 
-Open Telemetry Auto Instrumentation's minimal supported version is java 7.
+Open Telemetry Auto Instrumentation's minimal supported version is java 8.
 All jar files that we produce, unless noted otherwise, have bytecode
-compatible with java 7 runtime. In addition to that we test our code with all
-later java versions as well: from 8 to 15.
+compatible with java 8 runtime. In addition to that we test our code with all
+later java versions as well: 11 and 15.

nodes.bodyText:
done
although build for 15 failed in the previous commit. It does not look like a flaky test. https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java-instrumentation/runs/1159434638#step:6:210
